ground_truth: Morgan is petting Houdini's fur gently. As Graham and Officer Paski get closer, they see Morgan is crying. Then they see the dog is laying on its side and has a barbecue fork in its neck. Bo is on top of the jungle gym curled up in a ball. They stare at Morgan as he slowly pulls an inhaler from his pocket and brings it to his mouth. He inhales the asthma spray and lowers the inhaler so he can speak. Graham stares at his ten-year-old son and starts crying. Graham picks him up in his arms and reaches up for Bo, who has dirt and tears on her face. She slowly climbs down, and Graham carries Bo as she cries in his arms. He starts towards the house. Merrill walks out from the back holding a bowl of potato salad and stands still. Graham reaches the porch of his house and opens the screen door. The children watch over their father's shoulder as Merrill runs to their other German Shepherd sitting quietly near the house and leads her by her collar across the yard to the shed. Officer Paski is pulling the barbecue fork out of their dead dog's neck. Graham lies in bed, resting his cheek against the pillow as he lies by himself. He slowly gets up from the bed, takes his daughter's hand, and starts out of the room. They both sit quietly for a moment. He looks to his daughter with startled eyes, and Graham's eyes drift to the bedroom window. A large silhouetted figure is seen. Graham stands as Merrill opens the front door. It's pitch black outside, and Merrill turns to Graham and gestures with his fingers, bringing them together at the end of the gesture. Merrill and Graham look out into the darkness. Graham runs through the darkness around the first corner of the house, and Merrill waves his arms and turns a corner full speed. The large figure has come into view as Merrill's eyes drift above them. Graham starts out of the kitchen, while Bo watches cartoons. Bo's cartoon is replaced by a special report news icon. Morgan takes the asthma inhaler from his pocket and breathes in deeply. Graham and Edgar walk down the driveway to Edgar's patrol car, and Graham turns the car off as Morgan nods and then plops back into the backseat. Downtown Bucks County is a group of small stores along a quiet street. The Hess family's station wagon pulls in front of a free parking meter. Graham steps out the driver's side and looks around as Merrill puts change in the meter. Morgan walks up to Graham with Bo, holds out his hand for money, and after receiving it from Graham, takes Bo's hand and walks down the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Morgan is gently petting the soft fur of Houdini, his beloved dog. As Graham and Officer Paski gradually approach the scene, they notice that Morgan is crying, tears streaming down his face. It becomes apparent why as they look at the dog, lying on its side with a barbecue fork protruding painfully from its neck. Meanwhile, Bo is perched on top of the jungle gym, curled up tightly in a ball, visibly distressed. They fix their gaze on Morgan as he slowly retrieves an inhaler from his pocket, bringing it to his lips to take a calming breath of the asthma spray. Once he has inhaled, he lowers the inhaler to speak. Graham, looking intently at his ten-year-old son, begins to cry, overcome with emotion. He gently picks up Morgan in his arms, his heart heavy, and reaches up for Bo, who is covered in dirt and tears staining her face. She gingerly climbs down, and Graham holds Bo tenderly as she sobs in his arms, comforting her as he starts to walk purposefully towards the house. Merrill emerges from the back, holding a bowl of potato salad, and pauses, taking in the scene. Graham reaches the porch of their home and carefully opens the screen door. As they pass, the children watch from over their father’s shoulder as Merrill makes his way to their other German Shepherd, sitting quietly beside the house, and gently leads her by the collar across the yard to the safety of the shed. Officer Paski is in the process of extracting the barbecue fork from the neck of their now-deceased dog. 

Later, Graham is lying alone in bed, his cheek resting against the pillow in a moment of quiet solitude. He slowly rises from the bed, tenderly takes his daughter's hand, and they exit the room together, sitting in silence for a brief moment of shared solace. He looks at his daughter with eyes wide, startled by something outside, and then his gaze shifts to the bedroom window. There, silhouetted against the darkness, a large figure is visible. Graham stands up as Merrill opens the front door, and they both peer into the pitch-black outside. Merrill turns to Graham and gestures with his fingers, signaling for him to pay attention. 

In response, both Merrill and Graham look out into the enveloping darkness. With urgency, Graham runs through the dark around the first corner of the house, while Merrill waves his arms, turning a corner at full speed. As they do, the large figure comes into clear view, and Merrill’s eyes drift upward to take in the sight. Graham makes his way out of the kitchen, leaving behind Bo, who is engrossed in watching cartoons. However, Bo's cartoon is abruptly replaced by a special report news icon on the screen. Meanwhile, Morgan takes out his asthma inhaler from his pocket again, breathing it in deeply. Graham and Edgar proceed down the driveway towards Edgar’s patrol car. Graham reaches in and turns off the car’s engine as Morgan nods and then relaxes back into the backseat. In downtown Bucks County, a quaint collection of small stores line the quiet street. The Hess family’s station wagon pulls up to a vacant parking meter. Graham emerges from the driver’s side of the vehicle, glancing around as Merrill inserts change into the meter. Morgan approaches Graham with Bo, extending his hand for money. After receiving it from Graham, Morgan takes Bo’s hand and they walk together down the sidewalk, setting off on their way.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Morgan is gently stroking the soft fur of Houdini, his cherished dog, with great tenderness and care. As Graham and Officer Paski gradually make their way toward the scene, they observe that Morgan is shedding tears, which are streaming freely down his face. The reason for his distress becomes painfully clear as they glance at the dog, lying motionless on its side with a barbecue fork protruding cruelly from its neck. Meanwhile, Bo is perched high atop the jungle gym, curled up tightly into a ball, visibly shaken and distressed by the unfolding events.

Their attention shifts back to Morgan as he slowly and deliberately takes an inhaler from his pocket, raising it to his lips to take a much-needed, calming breath of the asthma spray. Once he has inhaled the soothing mist, he lowers the inhaler from his face to speak. Graham, gazing intently at his ten-year-old son with deep concern, begins to cry as well, overwhelmed with emotion. He tenderly lifts Morgan into his arms, his heart heavy with sorrow, and reaches up to gather Bo, who is covered in dirt, with tears staining her face. She gingerly climbs down, and Graham holds Bo close, comforting her as she sobs in his embrace. With a sense of purpose, he starts to walk towards the house. Merrill then emerges from the back, carrying a bowl of potato salad, and pauses momentarily, taking in the somber scene. Graham reaches the porch of their home and carefully opens the screen door. As they pass through, the children watch over their father’s shoulder as Merrill makes his way to their other German Shepherd, who is sitting quietly beside the house, and gently leads her by the collar across the yard to the safety of the shed nearby. Meanwhile, Officer Paski is in the process of carefully extracting the barbecue fork from the neck of their now-deceased dog.

Later on, Graham finds himself lying alone in bed, his cheek resting softly against the pillow, seeking a moment of quiet solace. He slowly rises from the bed, gently takes his daughter's hand in his, and they exit the room together, sitting in silence for a brief moment of shared solitude. He looks at his daughter with wide eyes, startled by something outside, and then his gaze shifts to the bedroom window. There, silhouetted against the darkness, a large, imposing figure becomes visible. Graham stands up just as Merrill opens the front door, and together, they both peer into the pitch-black outside. Merrill turns to Graham and gestures with his fingers, signaling for him to pay attention to what might be happening.

In response, both Merrill and Graham focus their gaze into the enveloping darkness. With urgency, Graham runs through the dark around the first corner of the house, while Merrill waves his arms energetically, turning a corner at full speed. As they move, the large figure comes into clear view, and Merrill’s eyes drift upward, taking in the sight with a mix of apprehension and curiosity. Graham makes his way out of the kitchen, leaving Bo behind, who is deeply engrossed in watching cartoons. However, Bo's cartoon is suddenly replaced by a special report news icon on the screen, catching her attention. Meanwhile, Morgan retrieves his asthma inhaler from his pocket once again, breathing it in deeply to calm himself.

Graham and Edgar proceed down the driveway towards Edgar’s patrol car. Graham reaches in and turns off the car’s engine as Morgan nods in understanding and then relaxes back into the backseat. In downtown Bucks County, a quaint collection of small stores line the tranquil street. The Hess family’s station wagon comes to a stop at a vacant parking meter. Graham emerges from the driver's side of the vehicle, glancing around the area as Merrill inserts change into the meter with precision. Morgan approaches Graham with Bo by his side, extending his hand for money. After receiving the money from Graham, Morgan takes Bo’s hand, and together, they walk down the sidewalk, setting off on their way with a sense of camaraderie.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Morgan gently strokes Houdini’s fur with a tender touch, showing affection and care. As Graham and Officer Paski approach, they notice tears streaming down Morgan's face, indicating his distress. Their eyes then fall upon the sight of the dog lying on its side with a barbecue fork gruesomely embedded in its neck. Nearby, Bo is perched atop the jungle gym, tightly curled up into a ball, conveying her own sense of fear or sadness. Morgan becomes the focus of their attention as he painstakingly retrieves an inhaler from his pocket, bringing it up to his lips with a deliberate motion. He inhales deeply, allowing the asthma spray to work, then lowers the inhaler, preparing himself to speak. Graham observes his son, only ten years old, and is overcome with emotion, tears beginning to well up as he watches him. In a gesture of comfort, Graham lifts Morgan into his arms, drawing him close. He extends his arms upwards, reaching for Bo, who hesitates but then slowly descends from her spot, her face marked with dirt and streaked with tears. As Bo reaches the ground, Graham gathers her into his embrace, holding both children securely as she cries into his shoulder. With a heavy heart, he begins to make his way toward the house. Meanwhile, Merrill emerges from the backyard, clutching a bowl of potato salad, only to freeze in place as he surveys the scene. Graham arrives at the porch, pulling open the screen door to usher the children inside. They watch intently over their father's shoulder as Merrill hastens toward their other German Shepherd, sitting quietly by the house. With urgency, Merrill leads the dog by its collar across the yard toward the shed. In a harrowing moment, Officer Paski resolutely extracts the barbecue fork from their dead dog's neck. Later, Graham lies in bed, resting his cheek against the pillow, solitude enveloping him. Slowly, he rises from the bed, reaches out to take his daughter's hand, and together they exit the room. They settle into a shared silence, the weight of the moment sinking in. Graham, with eyes wide in surprise, shifts his gaze toward the bedroom window and sees the silhouette of a large figure. Instinctively, he stands as Merrill opens the front door, revealing the pitch-black outside. Merrill turns to Graham, gesturing with his fingers in a closing motion. Both men peer into the darkness, trying to discern what might be lurking beyond. Without warning, Graham bolts into the night, rounding the first corner of the house, while Merrill follows, his arms waving as he turns the corner at full speed. The large figure becomes visible as Merrill's eyes trail upwards, catching sight of it. Graham exits the kitchen, where Bo sits absorbed in her cartoons. The broadcast suddenly changes, displaying a special report news icon on the screen. Morgan, feeling the tension rise, fishes out his asthma inhaler once more, taking a deep, calming breath. Graham and Edgar make their way down the driveway toward Edgar's patrol car. Graham reaches out, turning the car off, while Morgan acknowledges with a nod before slumping back into the backseat. In downtown Bucks County, a quaint array of small stores lines the quiet street. The Hess family station wagon maneuvers into position, parking neatly in front of an available meter. Graham steps out from the driver's side, scanning his surroundings as Merrill approaches the meter and deposits some change. Morgan approaches Graham with Bo by his side, extending his hand in a request for money. Graham obliges, handing Morgan some cash, after which Morgan takes Bo's hand and the two siblings stroll leisurely down the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Morgan gently pets Houdini's fur while crying, as Graham and Officer Paski approach and notice the barbecue fork in the dog's neck and Bo curled up on the jungle gym. Morgan uses his inhaler to speak, prompting Graham to tearfully pick him up and reach for a dirt- and tear-streaked Bo, who climbs down to be carried back toward the house. Merrill and Graham look out into the darkness, tense with anticipation. Graham runs through the darkness around the first corner of the house, his heart racing with adrenaline, and Merrill waves his arms and turns a corner full speed, driven by instinct to protect. The large figure has come into view as Merrill's eyes drift above them, revealing its ominous nature. Graham starts out of the kitchen, while Bo watches cartoons, her distraction from the fear outside. Bo's cartoon is replaced by a special report news icon, signaling an urgent broadcast. Graham and Edgar walk down the driveway to Edgar's patrol car, a vital tool in his police work, and Graham turns the car off as Morgan nods and then plops back into the backseat, seeking comfort in familiarity. Downtown Bucks County, a picturesque area known for its quaint charm, is a group of small stores along a quiet street. The Hess family's station wagon, a classic family vehicle, pulls in front of a free parking meter. Graham steps out the driver's side and looks around as Merrill puts change in the meter to ensure they don't receive a parking ticket. Morgan walks up to Graham with Bo, holds out his hand for money, and after receiving it from Graham, takes Bo's hand and walks down the sidewalk, their bond unspoken yet strong.

On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. They both sit quietly for a moment. He looks to his daughter with startled eyes and Graham's eyes drift to the bedroom window. A large silhouetted figure is seen. Graham stands as Merrill opens the front door. It is pitch black outside and Merrill turns to Graham and gestures with his fingers bringing them together at the end of the gesture. Merrill and Graham look out into the darkness. Graham runs through the darkness around the first corner of the house and Merrill waves his arms and turns a corner full speed. The large figure has come into view as Merrill's eyes drift above them. Graham starts out of the kitchen while Bo watches cartoons. Bo's cartoon is replaced by a special report news icon. Morgan takes the asthma inhaler from his pocket and breathes in deeply. Graham and Edgar walk down the driveway to Edgar's patrol car and Graham turns the car off as Morgan nods and then plops back into the backseat. Downtown Bucks County is a group of small stores along a quiet street. The Hess family's station wagon pulls in front of a free parking meter. Graham steps out the driver's side and looks around as Merrill puts change in the meter. Morgan walks up to Graham with Bo holds out his hand for money and after receiving it from Graham takes Bo's hand and walks down the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Morgan is petting Houdini's fur gently. As Graham and Officer Paski get closer they see Morgan is crying. Then they see the dog is laying on its side and has a barbecue fork in its neck. Bo is on top of the jungle gym curled up in a ball. They stare at Morgan as he slowly pulls an inhaler from his pocket and brings it to his mouth. He inhales the asthma spray and lowers the inhaler so he can speak. Graham stares at his tenyearold son and starts crying. Graham picks him up in his arms and reaches up for Bo who has dirt and tears on her face. Graham starts out of the kitchen while Bo watches cartoons. Bo's cartoon is replaced by a special report news icon. Morgan takes the asthma inhaler from his pocket and breathes in deeply. Graham and Edgar walk down the driveway to Edgar's patrol car and Graham turns the car off as Morgan nods and then plops back into the backseat. Downtown Bucks County is a group of small stores along a quiet street. The Hess family's station wagon pulls in front of a free parking meter. Graham steps out the driver's side and looks around as Merrill puts change in the meter. Morgan walks up to Graham with Bo holds out his hand for money and after receiving it from Graham takes Bo's hand and walks down the sidewalk.

Then they see the dog is laying on its side and has a barbecue fork in its neck. Bo is on top of the jungle gym curled up in a ball. The Hess family's station wagon pulls in front of a free parking meter. Graham steps out the driver's side and looks around as Merrill puts change in the meter. Morgan walks up to Graham with Bo holds out his hand for money and after receiving it from Graham takes Bo's hand and walks down the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Victoria is brushing Zorro's scales softly. As Devin and Detective Ramos drift closer, they notice Victoria is laughing. Then they see the parrot is perched on its branch and has a knitting needle in its wing. Liz is on top of the treehouse wrapped up in a blanket. They gaze at Victoria as she carefully extracts a flashlight from her backpack and lifts it to her eyes. She examines the bright light and lowers the flashlight so she can whisper. Devin gazes at his teenage nephew and bursts into laughter. Devin lifts him up in his hands and reaches down for Liz, who has paint and smiles on her face. She slowly slides down, and Devin cradles Liz as she laughs in his grasp. He heads towards the barn. Jethro steps out from the garage holding a basket of muffins and freezes. Devin reaches the step of his barn and pushes the gate open. The kids peer over their uncle's coat as Jethro jogs to their other tabby cat lounging lazily near the barn and guides her by her leash across the yard to the greenhouse. Detective Ramos is pulling the knitting needle out of their wounded parrot's wing. Devin lies on the couch, pressing his forehead against the cushion as he rests alone. He reluctantly rises from the couch, takes his son's foot, and wanders out of the den. They both sit silently for a moment. He glances to his son with wide eyes, and Devin's gaze shifts to the living room curtain. A large shadowy creature is visible. Devin stands as Jethro kicks the back door open. It's completely dark outside, and Jethro twists to Devin and signals with his hands, bringing them apart at the end of the gesture. Jethro and Devin peer into the void. Devin sprints through the void around the first hedge of the barn, and Jethro flails his hands and zips around a hedge full speed. The large creature has appeared as Jethro's gaze wanders below them. Devin shuffles out of the pantry, while Liz watches soap operas. Liz's soap opera is swapped out by a weather alert symbol. Victoria pulls the flashlight from her backpack and examines it closely. Devin and Carlos stroll down the pathway to Carlos's motorcycle, and Devin pushes the motorcycle forward as Victoria grins and then tumbles back into the sidecar. Urban Bucks County is a cluster of tall towers along a bustling road. The Lee family's convertible parks in front of an available bicycle rack. Devin hops out the passenger side and peeks around as Jethro slides cash into the meter. Victoria ambles up to Devin with Liz, extends her hand for tickets, and after obtaining them from Devin, takes Liz’s hand and strolls down the avenue.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Morgan gently pets Houdini, tears streaming down as Graham and Officer Paski arrive, noticing the dog has a barbecue fork in its neck. Bo is curled up on the jungle gym. Morgan uses his inhaler, and Graham picks him up, reaching for Bo, who descends with tears. Graham carries them towards the house. Merrill, holding potato salad, watches as Graham enters the porch. Merrill then guides their other German Shepherd to the shed. Officer Paski removes the fork from the dead dog's neck. Graham lies alone in bed, then takes Bo's hand, with a large silhouetted figure appearing at the window. Merrill gestures to Graham as they look into the darkness. Graham and Merrill chase the figure around the house. Bo's cartoon switches to a news report. Morgan uses his inhaler again. Graham and Edgar walk to Edgar's patrol car, turning it off. In downtown Bucks County, the Hess family parks their station wagon. Graham exits, and Merrill feeds the meter. Morgan, with Bo, asks Graham for money and then walks down the sidewalk with her.
